references.paper_title: Semantic image segmentation with deep convolutional nets and fully connected crfs
references.reason: This paper is foundational for semantic segmentation, introducing deep convolutional neural networks and fully connected CRFs, and is frequently cited in the field.

references.paper_title: Fully convolutional networks for semantic segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduced the fully convolutional network (FCN) architecture, which revolutionized semantic segmentation by enabling end-to-end pixel-wise prediction.
This is a seminal work on few-shot semantic segmentation, introducing a novel approach that utilizes prototype learning and is fundamental to the field of few-shot learning.
This paper directly addresses cross-domain few-shot semantic segmentation, a challenging task that involves transferring knowledge across different domains, which is the focus of the current paper.
This paper is highly relevant as it proposes a method for few-shot segmentation that focuses on managing inter-channel correlations, a key aspect of the current paper’s approach.
